channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Elon Musk reportedly buys a $35 million compound in Austin to house his 11 kids and their moms
item.description: Elon Musk is said to have grand plans to bring all of his children together under one Texas roof.

item.title: The 'Trump Trade' Isn't What You Think
item.description: Some investments tied to a Trump win clearly worked, but with questionable logic. Others worked but at least in part for the wrong reasons. Some faile...

item.title: Here’s the big barrier Amazon stock must overcome to reach fresh highs
item.description: There is a fundamental reason why the shares have been rebuffed at the $200 mark

item.title: Why $11 Trillion in Assets Isn't Enough for BlackRock's Larry Fink
item.description: Fink wants to push the world’s largest asset manager into the more lucrative world of private markets.

item.title: OPEC+ Output Hike Delay Signals Price Concerns
item.description: Crude futures were more than 2% higher in Europe but DNB Markets said OPEC+’s decision to further delay its planned production increase indicates the ...

item.title: Bond yields dive after key Iowa poll points to tight U.S. election
item.description: Bond yields fell on Monday, reversing most of the previous session’s action after a key poll suggested a tighter election race than expected.

item.title: Gold Edges Lower Ahead of U.S. Election, Fed Decision
item.description: Gold edged lower in early European trade as investors exercised caution ahead of the U.S. election and the Fed’s monetary policy decision.

item.title: Stock Futures Up as Bonds Rally and Dollar, Oil Prices Weaken
item.description: Futures tied to the S&P 500, Nasdaq-100 and the Dow industrials edged higher.

item.title: Should I wait until after the presidential election before investing $300,000 in stocks? I’m a 66-year-old retiree.
item.description: “I have most of my expenses covered.”

item.title: Michael Bloomberg’s $50 million donation to Harris campaign could be half of what the billionaire’s real estate is worth
item.description: From the Hamptons to the Bahamas, Bloomberg has amassed an incredible portfolio of lavish properties around the globe.
